description: {"blocks":[{"key":"9qlv","text":"This is a protocol that describes the process of isolating single cells from healthy knee cartilage for single cell RNAseq.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

groups.title: Human BioMolecular Atlas Program (HuBMAP) Method Development Community

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2j637","text":"~1.5 g of articular cartilage from healthy donor knees (grades 0-1) is resected from the medial condyle of the proximal femur. For details regarding the tissue harvesting procedure please see ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbv7k","text":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.14egn7996v5d/v1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":48}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"FF2CC13FC66111EC9FE10A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.14egn7996v5d/v1"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5tgsi","text":"Cartilage shavings are washed with   Dulbecco's Phosphate Buffered Solution (DPBS) supplemented with 10% calf serum (CS), 1% Antibiotic : Antimycotic (Anti-Anti) and 1% Penicillin-Streptomycin-Glutamine (PSG).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5p79a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"8B41FF70C65911EC8FF36582825C58EE","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dalev","text":"Cartilage shavings are minced with a #21 Feather disposable scalpel, and digested in 20mL Dulbecco's Modified Eagle Medium (DMEM) supplemented with 1% Anti-Anti and 2% collagenase type II with 100 rpm shaking at   for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":212,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":218,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4ftf0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2CF89B30AF9911ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":7200,"guid":"29773CA0AF9911ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c38v","text":"Cells are gently passed through a 100 Âµm filter into a 50 mL centrifuge tube followed by gentle passage through a 40 Âµm filter into a fresh 50 mL centrifuge tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2d54k","text":"Filtered cells are spun down at 1200 rpm for  at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":45,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"an6h4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"30A109C0AF9911ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9A89D2E0AF9E11ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90leh","text":"The supernatant is carefully removed, and the remaining cell pellet is delicately resuspended in 10mL of   DPBS supplemented with 5% CS and 5 mM Ethylenediamine tetraacetic acid (EDTA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":105,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"72pr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"9864BAD0C65911EC8FF36582825C58EE","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1bn2m","text":"Resuspended single cells are treated with DNase I at a concentration of 100 ug/mL for   at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":86,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":91,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eilct","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"guid":"5081E570AF9911ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A2887C30AF9E11ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7dm8m","text":"Single cells are spun down at 1200 rpm for   at  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":43,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fbode","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"57B6D620AF9911ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A699BEB0AF9E11ECA2EE7D596297EB90","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":32}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ofih","text":"The supernatant is carefully removed, and the remaining cell pellet is delicately resuspended in 10 mL of DPBS supplemented with 0.04% Bovine Serum Albumin (BSA).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2nn8m","text":"The Invitrogen Countess II FL automated cell counter is used to quantify single cells and determine cell viability. Live cells are determined by trypan blue staining. If \u003e70% cell viability is confirmed, the single cell suspension is diluted to a concentration of 1x106cells/mL for single cell RNA-seq library preparation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":268,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Single-Cell Isolation of Human Articular Cartilage
